SEARCH
Package se.idsec.signservice.integration.document.pdf

Class PdfSignaturePage.PdfSignatureImagePlacementConfiguration

java.lang.Object
se.idsec.signservice.integration.document.pdf.PdfSignaturePage.PdfSignatureImagePlacementConfiguration
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Extensible
Enclosing class:
PdfSignaturePage
public static class PdfSignaturePage.PdfSignatureImagePlacementConfiguration extends Object implements Extensible
Representation of the configuration of where in a PDF signature page PDF signature images should be inserted.
See Also:

    • getScale

      public Integer getScale()
      Gets the scale of the final visible signature image expressed as zoom percentage. The value -100 represents a 0 sized image, the value 0 represents unaltered size, the value 100 double size and so on. If null, 0 is assumed.
      Returns:
      the scale of the final visible signature image

    • setScale

      public void setScale(Integer scale)
      Assigns the scale of the final visible signature image expressed as zoom percentage. The value -100 represents a 0 sized image, the value 0 represents unaltered size, the value 100 double size and so on. If null, 0 is assumed.
      Parameters:
      scale - the scale of the final visible signature image

    • getXIncrement

      public Integer getXIncrement()
      Gets the signature page document page number. If the PDF signature page document (see PdfSignaturePage.getContents()) contains more than one page it is possible to use the page attribute to tell where the PDF signature image(s) should be inserted. A value of 1 represents the first page and a value of 0 represents the last page. The default is 1.

      Note: If the PDF signature page only supports one row this property is ignored.

      Returns:
      the page number

    • setXIncrement

      public void setXIncrement(Integer xIncrement)
      Sets the signature page document page number. If the PDF signature page document (see PdfSignaturePage.getContents()) contains more than one page it is possible to use the page attribute to tell where the PDF signature image(s) should be inserted. A value of 1 represents the first page and a value of 0 represents the last page. The default is 1.

      Note: If the PDF signature page only supports one row this property is ignored.

      Parameters:
      xIncrement - the page number

    • getYIncrement

      public Integer getYIncrement()
      Gets the additional increment of Y coordinate position (in pixels) that should be added to the previously used yPosition when inserting a PDF signature image in a new row.

      Note: If the PDF signature page only supports one row this property is ignored.

      Returns:
      Y coordinate position increment

    • setYIncrement

      public void setYIncrement(Integer yIncrement)
      Sets the additional increment of Y coordinate position (in pixels) that should be added to the previously used yPosition when inserting a PDF signature image in a new row.
      Parameters:
      yIncrement - Y coordinate position increment Note: If the PDF signature page only supports one row this property is ignored.

    • getPage

      public Integer getPage()
      Gets the signature page document page number. If the PDF signature page document (see PdfSignaturePage.getContents()) contains more than one page it is possible to use the page attribute to tell where the PDF signature image(s) should be inserted. A value of 1 represents the first page and a value of 0 represents the last page. The default is 1.

      Note: It is only possible to have PDF signature images inserted into one page of the PDF signature page document.

      Returns:
      the page number

    • setPage

      public void setPage(Integer page)
      Sets the signature page document page number. If the PDF signature page document (see PdfSignaturePage.getContents()) contains more than one page it is possible to use the page attribute to tell where the PDF signature image(s) should be inserted. A value of 1 represents the first page and a value of 0 represents the last page. The default is 1.

      Note: It is only possible to have PDF signature images inserted into one page of the PDF signature page document.

      Parameters:
      page - the page number

      Returns the extension parameters for the instance.
